2 #define STATE_H

4 #include "ASLog.h"
5 #include "CostModel.h"
6 #include "DefaultCostModel.h"
7 #include "Featurization.h"
8 #include "Halide.h"
9 #include "LoopNest.h"
10 #include "PerfectHashMap.h"
11 #include <map>
12 #include <utility>
13 
14 namespace Halide {
15 namespace Internal {
16 namespace Autoscheduler {
17 
18 // A struct representing an intermediate state in the tree search.
19 // It represents a partial schedule for some pipeline.
20 struct State {
21  mutable RefCount ref_count;
22  // The LoopNest this state corresponds to.
23  IntrusivePtr<const LoopNest> root;
24  // The parent that generated this state.
25  IntrusivePtr<const State> parent;
26  // Cost of this state, as evaluated by the cost model.
27  double cost = 0;
28  // Number of decisions made at this state (used for finding which DAG node to schedule).
29  int num_decisions_made = 0;
30  // Penalization is determined based on structural hash during beam search.
31  bool penalized = false;
32 
33  // The C++ source code of the generated schedule for this State.
34  // Computed if `apply_schedule` is called.
35  string schedule_source;
36 
37  // The number of times a cost is enqueued into the cost model,
38  // for all states.
39  static int cost_calculations;
40 
41  State() = default;
42  State(const State &) = delete;
43  State(State &&) = delete;
44  void operator=(const State &) = delete;
45  void operator=(State &&) = delete;
46 
47  // Compute a structural hash based on depth and num_decisions_made.
48  // Defers to root->structural_hash().
49  uint64_t structural_hash(int depth) const;
50 
51  // Compute the featurization of this state (based on `root`),
52  // and store features in `features`. Defers to `root->compute_features()`.
53  void compute_featurization(const FunctionDAG &dag,
54  const MachineParams &params,
55  StageMap<ScheduleFeatures> *features);
56 
57  // Calls `compute_featurization` and prints those features to `out`.
58  void save_featurization(const FunctionDAG &dag,
59  const MachineParams &params,
60  std::ostream &out);
61 
62  // Performs some pruning to decide if this state is worth queuing in
63  // the cost_model. If it is, calls `cost_model->enqueue` and returns true,
64  // otherwise sets `cost` equal to a large value and returns false.
65  bool calculate_cost(const FunctionDAG &dag, const MachineParams &params,
66  CostModel *cost_model, int64_t memory_limit,
67  bool verbose = false);
68 
69  // Make a child copy of this state. The loop nest is const (we
70  // make mutated copies of it, rather than mutating it), so we can
71  // continue to point to the same one and so this is a cheap
72  // operation.
73  IntrusivePtr<State> make_child() const;
74 
75  // Generate the successor states to this state.
76  // If they are not pruned by `calculate_cost()`,
77  // then calls `accept_child()` on them.
78  void generate_children(const FunctionDAG &dag,
79  const MachineParams &params,
80  CostModel *cost_model,
81  int64_t memory_limit,
82  std::function<void(IntrusivePtr<State> &&)> &accept_child) const;
83 
84  // Dumps cost, the `root` LoopNest, and then `schedule_source` to `aslog(0)`.
85  void dump() const;
86 
87  // Apply the schedule represented by this state to a Halide
88  // Pipeline. Also generate source code for the schedule for the
89  // user to copy-paste to freeze this schedule as permanent artifact.
90  // Also fills `schedule_source`.
91  void apply_schedule(const FunctionDAG &dag, const MachineParams &params);
92 };
93 
94 } // namespace Autoscheduler
95 } // namespace Internal
96 } // namespace Halide
97 
98 #endif // STATE_H
